comments:
Driver: CVS code on 2005-10-14

To-reproduce:
1. Launch runtime-workbench and launch a Java app with IAC
2. Finish the app, everything runs fine so far.
3. Relaunch the Java app 
4. While the relaunch Java app is still in active/attach mode, relaunch the Java
app again.
4. Note processes are created on client side, but the agent for the last
relaunch does not have any status.

Look into the .metadata for tptp_iac.log tptp_iac_data.log and don't see the
last relaunch processes in the log.

I also see the following exception:

Also have changed the launch configuration to select IAC as default for new
configuration when RAC is not running. RAC will be set as default if RAC is
detected to be running.

I am reopening this bug as the scenario failed on
tptp.runtime-TPTP-4.1.0-200510240100 driver.
The process is failed to launch on Window2000 due to PID retrieval failure.
A dll is created by Samson to solve the problem and it's tested and runs fine on
my Win2k driver.
*** Bug 113958 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Found a workaround to handle the missing Win32 API.

Source and DLL checked into CVS 2005/12/28 15:47 EDT.
- tptpCommon.dll
- tptpCommon.c
